headline: Exxon Mobil Flags EU Methane Rules As Cost Risk For Valued Shares
summary: Exxon Mobil (NYSE:XOM) has warned that the European Union's proposed methane emissions rules could sharply increase crude import costs for the region. The company says compliance challenges under the draft rules may affect supply into Europe and weigh on the region's industrial competitiveness. This public stance puts a spotlight on regulatory risk for global energy producers and European refiners linked to EU climate policy. For you as an investor, this matters because Exxon Mobil is a...

headline: Energy Stocks Are Winning 2026. Why They Could Keep Going.
summary: Energy stocks are the market’s big winners so far this year, jumping 20% when the S&P 500 is up a measly 2%.  There are practical reasons why energy is the best sector in the market today.  The artificial-intelligence trade is no longer lifting all boats, and some tech stocks have fallen by double-digit percentages this year because of fears that AI will erode their market share.

headline: VYM’s S&P Beating Dividend Survived Two Decades Without Missing a Payment
summary: Vanguard High Dividend Yield Index Fund ETF Shares (NYSEARCA:VYM) generates income by holding a diversified portfolio of dividend-paying U.S. stocks and passing those dividends directly to shareholders. With $88.5 billion in assets and an ultra-low 0.06% expense ratio, VYM offers cost-efficient exposure to companies that consistently return cash to investors. The fund currently yields 2.45%, ... VYM’s S&P Beating Dividend Survived Two Decades Without Missing a Payment

headline: TotalEnergies Slashes Buyback, Boosts Savings Target as Lower Prices Hit Profit
summary: TotalEnergies  said it would reduce stock buybacks and step up cost savings after lower oil prices hit its fourth-quarter results.  TotalEnergies said Wednesday that it would halve its quarterly buyback to $750 million, with planned repurchase shares valued at between $3 billion and $6 billion for the year as a whole.

headline: Is Exxon Mobil (XOM) Still Attractively Priced After A 41% One Year Rally?
summary: If you are wondering whether Exxon Mobil's share price still reflects fair value, you are not alone, especially with the stock on many investors' watchlists right now. The shares last closed at US$151.59, with returns of 5.5% over 7 days, 21.7% over 30 days, 23.6% year to date and 40.7% over the past year. This naturally raises questions about how much of the story is already priced in. Recent headlines around Exxon Mobil have focused on its scale in global energy markets and its role in...
